intro: Laplacea semiserrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved laplacea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a tubular shape. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
